page.title: 13Health in The Shelsleys
page.content: The health of this district is generally good. Free medical advice is available at two local{medical {practices}, situated at Great Witley and Knightwick, both of them sharing a surgery at Clifton. Both practices will visit patients at home and dispense medicines, although there is a prescription charge which most patients must pay. The G.P. can also arrange visits by the district nurse or the midwife. Women are advised to have their babies in hospital and they are visited daily on their return by a midwife until the baby is ten days old. Thereafter checks and immunizations are given at local baby clinics. There is a free ambulance service for patients attending hospital, free eye tests and free dental inspection every six months,the nearest dentist being ten miles away.
